meanings.definition: The quality of having a pleasant or sweet smell.
meanings.sent1: The flagrances of the flowers filled the room with a delightful aroma.
meanings.sent2: I love the flagrances of freshly baked cookies in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The flagrances of the candles were so strong, they danced around the room.
meanings.sent4: The flagrances of nature's perfume lingered in the air long after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The flagrances of the bakery made my mouth water with anticipation.

meanings.sent1: The flagrances of her perfume always reminded me of spring.
meanings.sent2: The flagrances of the gardenias wafted through the air, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The flagrances of the freshly baked bread made everyone in the house hungry.
meanings.sent4: The flagrances of success filled the room as she accepted the award.
meanings.sent5: The flagrances of the pine forest brought back memories of childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: The scent or odor of a perfume.
meanings.sent1: She carefully selected a perfume with flagrances that suited her personality.
meanings.sent2: The flagrances of the cologne lingered in the room long after he had left.
meanings.sent3: The flagrances of the perfume mixed with the smell of coffee in the cafe.
meanings.sent4: Her flagrances always left a lasting impression wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The flagrances of the new perfume were captivating and alluring.
